result.execSummary:
The defendant Lameitris L Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 9/11/2015 AT 1:30 P.M.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.

No drugs or alcohol.
No vIolence or corporal punishment.  No use of belts or objects.
No firearms, weapons during the period of probation.

Successfully complete anger management, and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed approrpriate under terms set by BMCW.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests. Maintain absolute sobriety.

EACH COUNT:  Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid during period of probation or civil judgment. DV surcharge does not apply.
*Restitution set at zero.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

***06-15-15/ Mel Flanagan***

miscConds.notes: Conditions as listed on count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lameitris L Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lameitris L Brown in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Amended JOC reflects 06-15-15 Court order for 03-26-15 offense date as to Count 2

Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed 6-15-2015 and filed 6-19-2015.
-- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect an offense date of 3-26-2015 for count two.   mld
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mel Flanagan, Br. 4, for review. crt

Defendant Lameitris L Brown in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.    Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 25 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete Anger Management, 
   and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate, under terms set by BMCW.  
* No violence or corporal punishment.  No use of belts or objects.  
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
* No firearms; weapons during period of probation.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   --- dv surcharge does not apply
* Restitutionis set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 9-11-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
All parties notified as of 8-3-2015, this case is assigned to Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, in Room 504 of the Courthouse.   mld

Defendant Lameitris L Brown in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge to (2) two separate counts of Battery, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor."   mld

Defendant Lameitris L Brown in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsle.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements signed and filed.

Defendant Lameitris L Brown in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with QB dob 1/5/09 or LB dob 1/7/07 unless aprroved and monitored by BMCW.

Defendant Lameitris L Brown in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Lameitris L Brown in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
